JUDGES: András Sajó;David Thór Björgvinsson;Françoise Tulkens;Giorgio Malinverni;Paulo Pinto De Albuquerque
TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He is represented before the Court by Mr A. Yum and Mr PERSON , lawyers practising in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) are represented by their Agent .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE the Governorship of GPE expropriated a CARDINAL sq . m plot of land belonging to the applicant ( block no . CARDINAL , plot no . DATE ) , located in the Kocasinan Soğanlıbahçe region of GPE , GPE , to be used as a public school yard . It assessed the value of the land at MONEY ( TRL ) , that is , TRL CARDINAL per sq . m.

On DATE the administration sought to notify the applicant of the expropriation decision through a notary public . However , this notification did not reach the applicant as the service was made at the wrong address .
On DATE the applicant ’s lawyer obtained the expropriation decision from ORG in person and the expropriation was thus finalised .

On DATE , within the DATE prescription period stipulated in section QUANTITY of LAW ( Law no . CARDINAL ) , the applicant brought an action before ORG for additional expropriation compensation . He requested GPE CARDINAL in additional compensation , valuing the land at FAC per sq . m , and reserved the right to increase this claim . He did not request payment of interest .
On DATE the ownership of the plot of land was transferred to the administration in the title deed register .
On DATE the administration paid the applicant the previously assessed amount of TRL CARDINAL as compensation for expropriation .

On DATE the committee of experts appointed by ORG assessed the value of the land at FAC per sq . m. This evaluation was made on the basis of the value of the land on DATE , the date on which the applicant ’s lawyer was notified of the expropriation decision . The experts , however , noted that the compensation to be paid to the applicant at the end of the proceedings should be limited to his original claim in accordance with the relevant procedural rules .

On an unspecified date the applicant ’s lawyer submitted a petition to ORG , requesting that court , firstly , to apply interest on the amount of compensation to be awarded , and secondly to grant them additional time to bring an additional action ( “ ek dava ” ) to be able to claim an increased amount in compensation for the land .

At the hearing held on DATE the applicant ’s lawyer repeated his claim regarding the interest but did not bring up the request for an additional action . At the end of the hearing , ORG declared that the request regarding the interest would be entertained . It did not , however , take any decision on the request regarding an additional action , which had been made out of time .

Given the considerable discrepancy between the experts’ evaluation and that of the administration , the court appointed another committee of experts to report on the value of the land . This new committee conducted an examination on DATE and valued the land at TRL CARDINAL per sq . m as on DATE . However , it was again noted that the additional compensation was to be limited to the applicant ’s original claim .

On DATE the ORG accepted the applicant ’s claim in full and awarded him GPE CARDINAL in additional compensation , plus interest at the statutory rate running from DATE . That court stated that although the value of the land at the relevant time had been assessed to be higher in the expert reports , it was bound by the applicant ’s claim of GPE CARDINAL , and therefore could not award him a higher amount .

On an unspecified date , the applicant appealed against the judgment of the firstinstance court . He complained in particular that the value of his land had increased dramatically DATE , the date when he had brought the case before ORG , and DATE , the date when the second expert report had been obtained . In these circumstances , the insistence of the first - instance court on being bound by his initial claim had caused him significant financial loss . Having been obliged to bring his claim within the DATE prescription period , he could not possibly have foreseen such a radical increase in the value of his land .
On DATE ORG upheld the judgment of ORG .
On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s request for rectification of its previous decision . That decision was served on the applicant on DATE .
On DATE the administration paid the applicant TRL CARDINAL in additional compensation , including interest .

According to section CARDINAL of LAW ( Law no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE ) , the owner of an expropriated property may , within DATE of notification of the expropriation decision , bring an action to challenge the amount of compensation assessed by the authorities .
According to LAW , the civil courts are bound by the claims of the parties and may not award a higher amount than requested .
